intro: Dicymbe mollis, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family, which is characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, hairy stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, hairy pods containing several seeds. Dicymbe mollis is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
